required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Roflumilast on Lung Function in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Patients Treated With Salmeterol: The EOS Study (BY217/M2-127)
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Roflumilast in COPD Patients Treated With Salmeterol. A 24-week, Double-blind Study With 500 μg Roflumilast Once Daily Versus Placebo. The EOS Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to compare the efficacy of roflumilast on pulmonary function and symptomatic parameters in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) during concomitant administration of salmeterol. The study duration will last up to 28 weeks. The study will provide further data on safety and tolerability of roflumilast.

primary_outcome.measure: Pre-bronchodilator Forced Expiratory Volume in First Second (FEV1)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline over 24 weeks of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline during the treatment period in pre-bronchodilator FEV1 [L]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline over 24 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline during the treatment period in post-bronchodilator FEV1 [L]

secondary_outcome.measure: COPD Exacerbation Rate (Mild, Moderate or Severe)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean rate of COPD exacerbations requiring rescue medication of 3 or more puffs/day on at least 2 consecutive days (=mild COPD exacerbations), or requiring oral or parenteral glucocorticosteroids (=moderate COPD exacerbations), or requiring hospitalization, or leading to death (=severe COPD exacerbations), per patient per year. A COPD exacerbation is an event in the natural course of the disease characterized by a change in the patient's baseline dyspnea, cough and/or sputum beyond day-to-day variability sufficient to warrant a change in management [ATS / ERS 2005].

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline over 24 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The TDI is a recognized questionnaire to measure dyspnea in an out patient COPD population. At baseline, 3 components of dyspnea, each graded with 4 questions, were asked: - Functional Impairment - Magnitude of Task - Magnitude of Effort At each of the post-randomization visits questions from the TDI were asked related to 3 components: Change in - Functional Impairment - Magnitude of Task - Magnitude of Effort Each question in the TDI is graded from -3 (major deterioration) to +3 (major improvement). This results in a TDI Focal Score ranging from -9 to +9.

secondary_outcome.measure: Shortness of Breath Questionnaire (SOBQ) Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline over 24 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline during the treatment period in SOBQ. This is a 24-item measure that assesses self-reported shortness of breath while performing a variety of activities of daily living. The questions were administered at visits V0, V2, V3, V4, V5, V6 and Vend to assess the perceived shortness of breath of the patient. For each activity listed in the questionnaire the patient should rate his/her breathlessness on a scale between zero and five, where zero is "not at all breathless" and five is "maximally breathless or too breathless to do the activity".

arm_group.description: Roflumilast 500 µg underlying medication: salmeterol 50 μg, twice daily, inhaled
Placebo underlying medication: salmeterol 50 μg, twice daily, inhaled

intervention.description: 500 µg, once daily, oral administration in the morning

criteria.textblock:
Main Inclusion Criteria:
- History of COPD for at least 12 months prior to baseline visit
- FEV1/FVC ratio (post-bronchodilator) ≤ 70%
- FEV1 (post-bronchodilator) between ≥ 40% and ≤ 70% of predicted
Main Exclusion Criteria:
- COPD exacerbation indicated by a treatment with systemic glucocorticosteroids and/or antibiotics not stopped at least 4 weeks prior to baseline visit

results_reference.citation: Fabbri LM, Calverley PM, Izquierdo-Alonso JL, Bundschuh DS, Brose M, Martinez FJ, Rabe KF; M2-127 and M2-128 study groups. Roflumilast in moderate-to-severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease treated with longacting bronchodilators: two randomised clinical trials. Lancet. 2009 Aug 29;374(9691):695-703. doi: 10.1016/S0140-6736(09)61252-6.

group.title: Roflumilast
group.description: Roflumilast 500 µg, once daily, oral and salmeterol 50 µg, twice daily, inhaled

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo, once daily, oral and salmeterol 50 µg, twice daily, inhaled

participants_list.participants: Includes all randomized patients who took at least one dose of the investigational drug.
Includes all randomized patients who took at least one dose of the investigational drug.

outcome.description: Mean change from baseline during the treatment period in pre-bronchodilator FEV1 [L]
outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline over 24 weeks of treatment
outcome.population: ITT (Intention to Treat) analysis. Number of participants analyzed = number of participants with data available.

measure.title: Pre-bronchodilator Forced Expiratory Volume in First Second (FEV1)
measure.description: Mean change from baseline during the treatment period in pre-bronchodilator FEV1 [L]
measure.population: ITT (Intention to Treat) analysis. Number of participants analyzed = number of participants with data available.

analysis.p_value_desc: No adjustment of the significance level (0.05) was done as a hierarchical approach for hypotheses testing was used.
analysis.method_desc: Repeated measurements analysis (change from baseline over 24 weeks of treatment taking all post-randomization measurements into account).

outcome.title: COPD Exacerbation Rate (Mild, Moderate or Severe)
outcome.description: Mean rate of COPD exacerbations requiring rescue medication of 3 or more puffs/day on at least 2 consecutive days (=mild COPD exacerbations), or requiring oral or parenteral glucocorticosteroids (=moderate COPD exacerbations), or requiring hospitalization, or leading to death (=severe COPD exacerbations), per patient per year. A COPD exacerbation is an event in the natural course of the disease characterized by a change in the patient's baseline dyspnea, cough and/or sputum beyond day-to-day variability sufficient to warrant a change in management [ATS / ERS 2005].

outcome.title: Transition Dyspnea Index (TDI) Focal Score
outcome.description: The TDI is a recognized questionnaire to measure dyspnea in an out patient COPD population. At baseline, 3 components of dyspnea, each graded with 4 questions, were asked: - Functional Impairment - Magnitude of Task - Magnitude of Effort At each of the post-randomization visits questions from the TDI were asked related to 3 components: Change in - Functional Impairment - Magnitude of Task - Magnitude of Effort Each question in the TDI is graded from –3 (major deterioration) to +3 (major improvement). This results in a TDI Focal Score ranging from –9 to +9.
outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline over 24 weeks of treatment
outcome.population: ITT analysis. Number of participants analyzed = number of participants with data available.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The study results may be published and/or presented at scientific meetings. Prior to any submission, all manuscripts/abstracts must be presented to the sponsor for possible comments.
